title: How to write research design in research - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for your question. It’s very broad, and any answer really depends on several things: your area of interest, your level of experience, and the expectations and guidelines of your professors (or anyone else who will be reviewing your design). Take a look at this example of a research design for the social sciences. It has a good list of the things you need to consider for just about any type of research project. If you hover over each of the areas listed in the tabs, like Literature Review or Discussion, you’ll see additional details for each area. If your research involves experimental design (e.g., medicine, physics, chemistry, etc.), then you’ll have give additional attention to this area as well, as it would be crucial to the success of your efforts. And don’t forget to check with your professors for guidelines specific to your organization. Best of luck with your project. David
